oca.gloss: South American wood sorrel cultivated for its edible tubers

ocarina.gloss: egg-shaped terra cotta wind instrument with a mouthpiece and finger holes

occam.gloss: English scholastic philosopher and assumed author of Occam's Razor (1285-1349)

occam's razor.gloss: the principle that entities should not be multiplied needlessly

occasion.gloss: an event that occurs at a critical time

occident.gloss: the countries of (originally) Europe and (now including) North America and South America
the hemisphere that includes North America and South America

occipital cortex.gloss: that part of the cerebral cortex in either hemisphere of the brain lying in the back of the head

occipital lobe.gloss: that part of the cerebral cortex in either hemisphere of the brain lying in the back of the head

occipital vein.gloss: a vein that drains the occipital region

occitan.gloss: the medieval dialects of Langue d'oc (southern France)

occluded front.gloss: (meteorology) a composite front when colder air surrounds a mass of warm air and forces it aloft

occlusion.gloss: (meteorology) a composite front when colder air surrounds a mass of warm air and forces it aloft
an obstruction in a pipe or tube

occlusive.gloss: a consonant produced by stopping the flow of air at some point and suddenly releasing it

occult.gloss: having an import not apparent to the senses nor obvious to the intelligence

occupancy.gloss: an act of being a tenant or occupant
the act of occupying or taking possession of a building

occupant.gloss: someone who lives at a particular place for a prolonged period or who was born there

occupation.gloss: the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money
the control of a country by military forces of a foreign power
the act of occupying or taking possession of a building

occupation licence.gloss: a license to pursue a particular occupation

occupation license.gloss: a license to pursue a particular occupation

occupational disease.gloss: disease or disability resulting from conditions of employment (usually from long exposure to a noxious substance or from continuous repetition of certain acts)

occupational group.gloss: a body of people doing the same kind of work

occupational safety and health act.gloss: a law passed by the United States Congress that created the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to prevent employees from being injured or contracting diseases in the course of their employment

occupational safety and health administr.gloss: a government agency in the Department of Labor to maintain a safe and healthy work environment

occupier.gloss: someone who lives at a particular place for a prolonged period or who was born there

ocean.gloss: anything apparently limitless in quantity or volume

ocean bottom.gloss: the bottom of a sea or ocean

ocean floor.gloss: the bottom of a sea or ocean

ocean liner.gloss: a large commercial ship (especially one that carries passengers on a regular schedule)

ocean perch.gloss: large fish of northern Atlantic coasts of America and Europe

ocean pout.gloss: common along northeastern coast of North America

ocean trip.gloss: an act of traveling by water

oceanaut.gloss: a skilled worker who can live in underwater installations and participate in scientific research

oceania.gloss: a large group of islands in the south Pacific including Melanesia and Micronesia and Polynesia (and sometimes Australasia and the Malay Archipelago)

oceanic.gloss: relating to or occurring or living in or frequenting the open ocean

oceanic abyss.gloss: a long steep-sided depression in the ocean floor

oceanic bonito.gloss: fish whose flesh is dried and flaked for Japanese cookery

oceanic whitetip shark.gloss: large deep-water shark with white-tipped dorsal fin

oceanica.gloss: a large group of islands in the south Pacific including Melanesia and Micronesia and Polynesia (and sometimes Australasia and the Malay Archipelago)

oceanography.gloss: the branch of science dealing with physical and biological aspects of the oceans

oceanology.gloss: the branch of science dealing with physical and biological aspects of the oceans

ocellated turkey.gloss: wild turkey of Central America and northern South America

ocellus.gloss: an eye having a single lens
an eyelike marking (as on the wings of some butterflies)

ocelot.gloss: nocturnal wildcat of Central America and South America having a dark-spotted buff-brown coat

ochlocracy.gloss: a political system in which a mob is the source of control

ochna family.gloss: family of tropical evergreen trees and shrubs with thick shining parallel-veined leaves

ochna serrulata.gloss: shrub with narrow-elliptic glossy evergreen leaves and yellow flowers with leathery petaloid sepals

ochnaceae.gloss: family of tropical evergreen trees and shrubs with thick shining parallel-veined leaves

ochoa.gloss: United States biochemist (born in Spain) who studied the biological synthesis of nucleic acids (1905-1993)

ochotona collaris.gloss: similar to little chief hare and may be same species

ochroma lagopus.gloss: forest tree of lowland Central America having a strong very light wood

ocimum basilicum.gloss: annual or perennial of tropical Asia having spikes of small white flowers and aromatic leaves

ockham.gloss: English scholastic philosopher and assumed author of Occam's Razor (1285-1349)

ockham's razor.gloss: the principle that entities should not be multiplied needlessly

oconee bells.gloss: plant of southeastern United States having solitary white funnel-shaped flowers flushed with pink and large glossy green leaves that turn bronze-red in fall

ocotillo.gloss: desert shrub of southwestern United States and Mexico having slender naked spiny branches that after the rainy season put forth foliage and clusters of red flowers

oct.gloss: the month following September and preceding November

octad.gloss: the cardinal number that is the sum of seven and one

octal number system.gloss: a positional system of numeration that uses octal digits and a radix of eight

octal numeration system.gloss: a positional system of numeration that uses octal digits and a radix of eight

octane number.gloss: a measure of the antiknock properties of gasoline

octane rating.gloss: a measure of the antiknock properties of gasoline

octanedioic acid.gloss: a dicarboxylic acid found in cork

octave.gloss: a musical interval of eight tones

octavian.gloss: Roman statesman who established the Roman Empire and became emperor in 27 BC

octavo.gloss: the size of a book whose pages are made by folding a sheet of paper three times to form eight leaves

octet.gloss: the cardinal number that is the sum of seven and one
eight performers or singers who perform together
eight people considered as a unit

octette.gloss: eight performers or singers who perform together
eight people considered as a unit

october.gloss: the month following September and preceding November

october 12.gloss: a legal holiday commemorating the discovery of America by Christopher Columbus

october 24.gloss: a day for celebrating the founding of the United Nations

october revolution.gloss: the coup d'etat by the Bolsheviks under Lenin in November 1917 that led to a period of civil war which ended in victory for the Bolsheviks in 1922

octoberfest.gloss: a strong lager made originally in Germany for the Oktoberfest celebration

octonary.gloss: the cardinal number that is the sum of seven and one

octopus.gloss: bottom-living cephalopod having a soft oval body with eight long tentacles

ocular.gloss: of or relating to or resembling the eye

ocular muscle.gloss: one of the small muscles of the eye that serve to rotate the eyeball

oculist.gloss: a person skilled in testing for defects of vision in order to prescribe corrective glasses
a medical doctor specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of diseases of the eye

oculomotor.gloss: supplies extrinsic muscles of the eye

oculomotor nerve.gloss: supplies extrinsic muscles of the eye

ocyurus chrysurus.gloss: superior food fish of the tropical Atlantic and Caribbean with broad yellow stripe along the sides and on the tail

occupy.gloss: march aggressively into another's territory by military force for the purposes of conquest and occupation
consume all of one's attention or time

occasional.gloss: occurring or appearing at usually irregular intervals
occurring on a temporary or irregular basis
recurring or reappearing from time to time

occidental.gloss: denoting or characteristic of countries of Europe and the western hemisphere

occluded.gloss: (of a substance) taken into and retained in another substance

occupied.gloss: having ones attention or mind or energy engaged

octagonal.gloss: of or relating to or shaped like an octagon

octangular.gloss: of or relating to or shaped like an octagon
